00036 Point3D::Point3D() {
00037         this->x = 0.0;
00038         this->y = 0.0;
00039         this->z = 0.0;

00044         this->y = point->getY();
00045         this->z = point->getZ();

00051         this->z = point.getZ();

00087 void Point3D::getRawData(Coordinate *pointBuffer) {
00088         pointBuffer[0] = x;
00089         pointBuffer[1] = y;
00090         pointBuffer[2] = z;
00091 }

00093 Point3D Point3D::operator +(const Point3D *point) {
00094         Point3D result;
00095         result.x = this->x + point->x;
00096         result.y = this->y + point->y;
00097         result.z = this->z + point->z;
00098 
00099         /* check if any value of x,y,z is infinity or not a number */
00100         if ((!(isfinite(result.x)) && (result.x != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.y))
00101                         && (result.y != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.z))
00102                         && (result.z != 0.0))) {
00103                 throw runtime_error(
00104                                 "Point3D operation exceeds the limit of Coordinate datatype representation.");
00105         }
00106 
00107         return result;
00108 }
00109 
00110 Point3D Point3D::operator -(const Point3D *point) {
00111         Point3D result;
00112         result.x = this->x - point->x;
00113         result.y = this->y - point->y;
00114         result.z = this->z - point->z;
00115 
00116         /* check if any value of x,y,z is infinity or not a number */
00117         if ((!(isfinite(result.x)) && (result.x != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.y))
00118                         && (result.y != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.z))
00119                         && (result.z != 0.0))) {
00120                 throw runtime_error(
00121                                 "Point3D operation exceeds the limit of Coordinate datatype representation.");
00122         }
00123 
00124         return result;
00125 }
00126 
00127 Point3D Point3D::operator *(double scalar) {
00128         Point3D result;
00129         result.x = (this->x) * static_cast<Coordinate>(scalar);
00130         result.y = (this->y) * static_cast<Coordinate>(scalar);
00131         result.z = (this->z) * static_cast<Coordinate>(scalar);
00132 
00133         /* check if any value of x,y,z is infinity or not a number */
00134         if ((!(isfinite(result.x)) && (result.x != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.y))
00135                         && (result.y != 0.0)) || (!(isfinite(result.z))
00136                         && (result.z != 0.0))) {
00137                 throw runtime_error(
00138                                 "Point3D operation exceeds the limit of Coordinate datatype representation.");
00139         }
00140 
00141         return result;
00142 }

00144 Point3D& Point3D::operator=(const Point3D &point) {
00145         if (this == &point) { //case of self assignment
00146                 return *this;
00147         }
00148         this->x = point.getX();
00149         this->y = point.getY();
00150         this->z = point.getZ();
00151         return *this;
00152 }
00153 
00154 void Point3D::homogeneousTransformation(IHomogeneousMatrix44 *transformation) { //TODO throw exception if values exceed limits
00155         // NOTE: currently everything is done in "double" and afterward transformed to "Coordinate"
00156         // This might involve implicit conversions between types (float to double e.g.) for each transformation...
00157         const double *homogenousMatrix;
00158         double xTemp;
00159         double yTemp;
00160         double zTemp;
00161 
00162         homogenousMatrix = transformation->getRawData();
00163 
00164         /*
00165          * layout:
00166          * 0 4 8  12
00167          * 1 5 9  13
00168          * 2 6 10 14
00169          * 3 7 11 15
00170          */
00171 
00172         /* rotate */;
00173         xTemp = x * homogenousMatrix[0] + y * homogenousMatrix[4] + z * homogenousMatrix[8];
00174         yTemp = x * homogenousMatrix[1] + y * homogenousMatrix[5] + z * homogenousMatrix[9];
00175         zTemp = x * homogenousMatrix[2] + y * homogenousMatrix[6] + z * homogenousMatrix[10];
00176 
00177         /* translate */
00178         x = static_cast<Coordinate>(xTemp + homogenousMatrix[12]);
00179         y = static_cast<Coordinate>(yTemp + homogenousMatrix[13]);
00180         z = static_cast<Coordinate>(zTemp + homogenousMatrix[14]);
00181 }
00182 
00183 istream& operator>>(istream &inStream, Point3D &point) {
00184         if (!inStream.good())
00185                 throw runtime_error("ERROR: cannot read x coordinate of point.");
00186         inStream >> point.x;
00187         if (!inStream.good())
00188                 throw runtime_error("ERROR: cannot read y coordinate of point.");
00189         inStream >> point.y;
00190         if (!inStream.good())
00191                 throw runtime_error("ERROR: cannot read z coordinate of point.");
00192         inStream >> point.z;
00193 
00194         return inStream;
00195 }
00196 
00197 ostream& operator<<(ostream &outStream, const Point3D &point) {
00198         outStream << point.getX() << " " << point.getY() << " " << point.getZ();
00199 
00200         return outStream;
00201 }
